LanguageData.AP_OutsideMapBounds: Prefab can't be built, it falls outside the map's bounds.
LanguageData.AP_OccupiedBy: Prefab can't be built. {0} is blocking construction.
LanguageData.AP_ImpassableTerrain: Prefab can't be built. Impassable terrain, "{0}" is blocking construction.
LanguageData.AP_GeyserAt: Prefab can't be built over a steam geyser
LanguageData.AP_ImpassableTerrainDeploy: Can't deploy prefab on impassable terrain: "{0}"
LanguageData.AP_NeedsDeployment: This prefab needs to be deployed by a colonist
LanguageData.AP_ResearchNotFinished: Research "{0}" needs to be finished before being able to buy this prefab
LanguageData.AP_NotAllModsPresent: This prefab is lacking one or more mods needed to buy it
LanguageData.AP_NotEnoughMoney: Not enough silver. You need at least {0} silver around valid trade beacons to buy this prefab
LanguageData.AP_TotalPrefabValue: Total prefab value estimated at {0} simoleons
LanguageData.AP_PrefabLockingResearches: This prefab requires the following researches: {0}
LanguageData.AP_PrefabMods: This prefab requires the following mods: {0}
LanguageData.AP_BuildPrefabDesc: Build the prefab structure contained inside this builder. The prefab won't be built if there are already buildings or impassable terrain in the indicated area.
LanguageData.AP_UndeployPrefabDesc: Cancels prefab deployment, transforming the prefab builder into an item that can be again moved.
LanguageData.AP_OpenPrefabCatalogDesc: Open a catalog to browse all available prefabs. To buy prefabs you'll need a trading beacon with silver on its effect radius.
LanguageData.AP_DevModeDescription: Dev mode will allow you to build certain structures that are useful to create your own prefabs. As a player this won't do much for you. Requires a game restart.
LanguageData.AP_NoSilverModeDescription: With this mode prefabs can be acquired on the catalog without paying for them. Intended for basebuilding and creative playthroughs.
LanguageData.AP_NoResearchLockingModeDescription: With this mode prefabs can be acquired on the catalog even if the player doesn't have the required research projects finished. Not intended for a normal playthrough as it will get players access to non-researched items.
LanguageData.AP_NoPrefabCatalog: No prefab catalog building mode (requires game restart)
LanguageData.AP_NoPrefabCatalogDescription: With this mode the prefab choosing dialog will be accessed via a designator in the Furniture architect menu, instead of having access to a prefab catalog building on the Misc architect menu.
LanguageData.AP_NoModLockingModeDescription: With this mode active prefabs will still show up on the catalog even if the player doesn't have the required mods. Bear in mind that prefabs using mods you don't have will still be built, only lacking that mod's objects.
LanguageData.AP_HideSillyDescription: On second thought, let's not go to Camelot. It is a silly place. Removes the "Silly" category, both from the prefab catalog and from appearing on traders, quest rewards, etc.
LanguageData.AP_CostMultiplierDesc: By default, prefabs can be bought for 60% or the price of all the materials of their components. With this you can make them cheaper or more expensive to fit your needs.
